newsitem.title: USA: Matrix drops skin-cancer drug - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Matrix drops skin-cancer drug - WSJ.

text.p: Matrix Pharmaceuticals Inc has dropped development of its skin cancer drug AccuSite Injectable Gel, The Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.
The company dropped development of the drug as treatment for basal cell cancer, the most common type of skin cancer, after looking at data from an ongoing trial.
Matrix had hoped to apply for Food and Drug Administration approval next year for the treatment.
Matrix shares were the second most-active on the Nasdaq Stock Market on Wednesday, plunging $3.50 to end at $7.875 on volume of 6.6 million. Average daily volume is 190,000 shares.
